frame.name: Locative_scenario
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Figure</fen> is located with respect to a <fen>Ground</fen>, whose location is (generally) better known. This is accomplished by identifying the <fen>Figure</fen> as within a <fen>Profiled_region</fen>--a shape defined by an Image Schema, located at, on, or in the <fen>Ground</fen>, and scaled by context. Alternatively, a group of <fen>Figures</fen> is described within a symmetrical <fen>Profiled_region</fen> located simultaneously with respect to each of the <fen>Figures</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Figure
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity that is located with respect to the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Ground
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity with respect to which the <fen>Figure</fen> is located.</def-root>

FE.name: Figures
FE.definition: <def-root>The entities that are located with respect to each other.</def-root>

FE.name: Profiled_region
FE.definition: <def-root>The area with respect to the <fen>Ground</fen> or <fen>Figures</fen> in which the <fen>Figure</fen> or <fen>Figures</fen> reside.</def-root>
